alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 11:23PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until midnight PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated only isolated light rain showers have been occurring since 10 pm PDT. Minor flooding is ongoing from earlier moderate to heavy rainfall in some parts of the Las Vegas Valley where between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain had fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwest Las Vegas Valley around Centennial Hills and the south central part of the Vegas Valley near Silverado Ranch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
